1.title: Melting Siberia
1.plot: On his first-ever expedition to Siberia, host George Kourounis witnesses the alarming effect of melting permafrost, visits a 12,000-year-old dog, and camps out with reindeer herders on the chilliest night of his life.

2.title: The Unstoppable Force of Bangladesh
2.plot: Ground zero for climate change and at risk of being wiped off the map, George is in Bangladesh during monsoon season to see how resilient and creative locals are adapting to their increasingly hostile environment.

3.title: Iceberg Alley
3.plot: George heads to Newfoundland, Canada, the iceberg capital of the world, for an up-close look at these floating giants from above, from below, and from the very top of a frozen mountain on the move.

4.title: The Reshaping of Laos
4.plot: George explores Laos to witness a nation entering the modern world. He comes across ancient farming techniques, visits a conservation center that gives elephants a new way of life, and paddles an underground river that holds timely secrets.

5.title: Polar Peril
5.plot: George heads to Canada's far North to see how polar bears are coping.

1.title: Tornadoes
1.plot: George embarks on his annual pilgrimage to "Tornado Alley" to guide groups of people who want to witness the brute force of tornadoes in action. Along the way he faces giant hailstones, dust storms and quirky American roadside attractions.

2.title: Desert Monsoon
2.plot: Enlisting the help of fellow storm chaser R.J. Evans, George heads to Arizona to photograph spectacular lightning storms triggered by the desert monsoon season.

3.title: African Hellhole
3.plot: George explores the deadly Nyiragongo volcano in the Congo jungle. To get to its lava lake, he has to negotiate through armed conflict, a family of gorillas, severe weather and 11,000 foot hike up the side of the volcano.

4.title: Fire and Water
4.plot: George heads North to Yukon and Alaska to chase intense summer wildfires that plague the area during their 24 hours of daylight. George travels by train, bike, plane and whitewater raft to reach the fires but Mother Nature has other plans.

5.title: The Winds of Autumn
5.plot: George starts off the hurricane season by getting prepared in a wind tunnel. He and his chase partner Mark Robinson head to Newfoundland for wild weather action. Then, it's off to another encounter where the wild wind fans a raging inferno.

6.title: Wild Weather Season
6.plot: George revisits the site of his hairiest adventures. Whether it's descending into an Ethiopian volcano, almost driving into a Texas tornado or facing hurricane Katrina, George was right there at ground zero and lived to tell the tale.

7.title: Volcanic Wedding
7.plot: George and his bride tie the knot in an unusual and exotic way: on the edge of an erupting volcano in the South Pacific. Forget about catching the bouquet. At this wedding it's all about dodging red hot lava bombs.

8.title: Wild Water
8.plot: Water sustains life on Earth but it can also be one of the most destructive and dangerous elements. George investigates the wild side of water in class 5 river rapids, a flooded cave, and in the ocean surrounded by Great White Sharks.

9.title: Blizzard
9.plot: Mount Washington has the reputation of having the worst weather in the world. Its winds and ice are on par with a polar expedition. To crank up the extreme factor, George tries to get frozen solid by returning to his favorite wind tunnel.

10.title: Avalanche
10.plot: George travels to the Rocky Mountains to team up with an avalanche control crew. He fires explosives into the mountains to create controlled snow slides, and tests the ability of an avalanche rescue dog by being buried in a snow cave.

11.title: Fin del mundo
11.plot: George battles seasickness at South America's "Fin Del Mundo" ("End of the World"), a treacherous graveyard of shipwrecks that is home to melting glaciers along the Antarctic ozone hole.

12.title: Midwest Stormfest
12.plot: Tornado Alley draws George back like a moth to a flame. This season tornadoes begin early - in February. George follows big weather from Missouri West to the Dakotas, and dodges the huge, destructive Greensburg tornado in Southern Kansas.

13.title: Boiling Lake
13.plot: Tucked away in the mountains of Dominica Island lies a lake whose water literally boils and steams like a witch's cauldron. George wants to be the first person in history to rig a rope across the lake and explore its waters from above.

1.title: Island Caving
1.plot: Accompanied by a group of hardcore cavers from Alberta and British Columbia, George descends into spectacular caves that lead deep into the earth on Vancouver Island. The team carries inflatable kayaks to explore a dark underground river.

2.title: Hurricane
2.plot: Linking up with legendary storm chaser Jim Leonard, George flies to Jamaica to track Hurricane Dean. George then travels to Nova Scotia to experience the even bigger turmoil of Hurricane Noel at the iconic Maritime village of Peggy's Cove.

3.title: Waterspouts
3.plot: In the Florida Keys, George uses a motorboat, a van and small plane to get up close to waterspouts - the nautical cousins of tornadoes. He also meets some of the 25 million alligators that live in the Sunshine State.

4.title: Hawaii-Surf & Snow
4.plot: In Hawaii George explores the wild side: diving with Galapagos sharks, ascending to snow-covered Mauna Kea, dental cleaning by Peppermint Cleaner Shrimp, extreme surfing at Banzai Pipeline, getting his boots lit on fire by Kilauea volcano.

5.title: Thunder Down Under
5.plot: In Australia George teams up with storm chaser Jimmy Deguara to witness summer storms in the outback. While in Oz, he dives the magnificent Great Barrier Reef, and explores just how painful is the sting of the venomous Box Jellyfish.

6.title: Hottest and Coldest
6.plot: George meets ultra-marathon runners in searing heat of Death Valley and bone-chilling cold of the Yukon. He dog-sleds in snow and meets wild characters like Caveman Bill, who has lived alone in a cave through 12 long cold Yukon winters.

7.title: Italia Wild
7.plot: In Italy, George studies avalanches of Dolomite Mountains, meets engineers who keep Venice from sinking, and heads South to explore Italy's explosive volcanoes: Vesuvius, Etna and Stromboli.

8.title: Westcoast Winter Weather
8.plot: On Canada's rugged West Coast, George ice-climbs a frozen waterfall, uses ski-skins to climb Mt.Garibaldi to an alpine lake, visits a storm-watching lodge on British Columbia's Long Beach, home of winter surfing and massive Pacific storms.

9.title: Iceland: Fire and Ice
9.plot: George meets President of Iceland Ólafur Grímsson who spearheaded use of geothermal power; visits Blue Lagoon and geysers; explores volcanically active Haimaey Island and climbs an iceberg calving off the glaciers at Vatnajokull Lagoon.

10.title: Timbuktu: Birthplace of Hurricanes
10.plot: Dust storms can spin off from Africa into the Atlantic and morph into tropical hurricanes that threaten the Caribbean and USA. While searching for Timbuktu's dust storms, George finds adventure in the landscape and culture of West Africa.

11.title: Monsoon
11.plot: In India's monsoon season George wades through waist-deep water in Bombay and leach-filled waterfalls in Goa, finds people being swept away by rivers, and rebuilding bridges. He experiences an intense annual Hindu celebration.

12.title: Java: Land of Fire
12.plot: In the Pacific Ring of Fire island of Java, George explores new ash eruptions from Anak Krakatau, whose 1883 eruption shook the world. He travels to Merapi and descends into Kawah Ijen to explore the world's largest lake of sulfuric acid.

13.title: Indonesia
13.plot: In Indonesia George visits massive Komodo Dragons, explores steaming sulfur vents of Papandayan, visits villagers whose town got swept away by Sidoarjo Mudflow, and tackles his toughest climb to date - the very active Semeru Volcano.

1.title: Hurricane Triple Threat
1.plot: George chases deadly hurricanes in the USA: Gustav in Louisiana and Hanna in North Carolina. He then flies with USAF Hurricane Hunters into Ike over Cuba, meeting it again as it makes a wild destructive landfall in Galveston, Texas.

2.title: Elephant Cave
2.plot: Waterfall-shrouded Kitum Cave has been carved out by elephants in search of salt on Mount Elgon at the Kenya-Uganda border. George gets bitten by one of the cave bats suspected of carrying the deadly Marburg virus.

3.title: Eco-Disasters
3.plot: Eco-disasters: Uzbekistan's Aral Sea, once one of the largest freshwater lakes in the world, shrunk to 1/6 its previous size; a Crimea mountain carved into a submarine base; Chernobyl nuclear site reduced to a radioactive wasteland.

4.title: Costa Rica
4.plot: George explores the volcanoes of Costa Rica with an international team of scientists, rafts down white water rivers in full flood, rappels down raging waterfalls, and handles some of deadliest snakes this tropical country has to offer.

5.title: Antarctica
5.plot: From "Fin Del Mundo" George sails on a Russian icebreaker to Antarctica. After braving stormy Drake passage, he explores volcanic Deception Island, camps in Antarctic snow and paddles a kayak through icebergs calved off melting glaciers.

6.title: Arctic Winter
6.plot: George links up with two experienced polar adventurers to explore frigid Canadian Arctic winter. The team uses skis to cross the fractured sea ice of Frobisher Bay, then dog teams to head North through the spectacular Auyuittuq Mountains.

7.title: Polynesian Volcanoes
7.plot: In New Zealand George learns that an undersea volcano 1000 miles North in Tonga is creating a new island. After nautical mishaps, clad in nothing but underwear and a life jacket, George becomes one of the first explorers on this new land.

8.title: Highway to Hail
8.plot: George and his team head into "bears' cage", looking to get beat up by the biggest, baddest hailstones in Texas and Oklahoma. Their storm chasing vehicles don't look too pretty after coming through these massive storms.

9.title: Defying Gravity
9.plot: George experiences extremes of aviation and space training aboard Czech-built Albatross fighter jet, inside Zero-G plane, simulating zero gravity by diving 30,000 feet in giant parabolas and in spinning centrifuges producing 6 G's of force.

10.title: Under Pressure
10.plot: After submarine exploration of Grand Cayman Island, George dives with Canadian Armed Forces' experimental deep pressure unit. With explorers Chris Harvey-Clark and Phil Nuytten he investigates newly discovered "Black Smoker" deep sea vents.

11.title: Crystal Cave
11.plot: In 2000 in Chihuahua, Mexico, miners found a cave filled with giant crystals. Temperatures reach 120 degrees F and humidity nearly 100%. George leads an Explorers Club Flag Expedition into this extreme environment.

12.title: Venezuela Lightning
12.plot: Gas from Catatumbo swamps mixed with cold air from the Andes create a perpetual lightning storm on South America's largest lake. From here George canoes 84 km to world's highest waterfall, swims with piranhas and holds a huge Anaconda.

13.title: Empty Quarter
13.plot: The Empty Quarter is a windswept area of sand dunes. In a tiny corner of this vast desert lies Dubai, a glitzy ultra-modern playground. George heads out from Abu Dhabi on a 4W safari to see both sides of this corner of Arabia.

1.title: Burning Australia
1.plot: Will climate change make Australia uninhabitable? Follow storm chaser George Kourounis as he explores the now brutal Australian summer and imbeds with the firefighters battling one of the biggest bushfires in recent years.

2.title: Vanuatu
2.plot: Climate change deniers claim volcanoes produce more greenhouse gases than fossil fuels do. George investigates this claim while revisiting the active volcano of Marum in Vanuatu. He dons a fire-suit and descends 1200 feet into the volcano.

3.title: Rising Oceans
3.plot: If melting polar ice continues to raise the world's ocean levels, the low-lying island of Tuvalu in the South Pacific will be one of the first to vanish. George visits the vanishing island, and looks back on two major ocean storms of recent years.

4.title: River of Doubt
4.plot: In 1914, U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt became the first person to navigate Brazil's "River of Doubt." The Angry Planet team returns to follow in his wake and investigate the changing climate in this remote part of the Amazon wilderness.

5.title: Cabo Verde Volcano
5.plot: When the Fogo volcano in the Cabo Verde Islands suddenly becomes active, George rushes to investigate. He returns with stark images and tragic stories from one of the most destructive volcano eruptions in recent years.

-1.title: Columbia
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Angry Planet
plot: Follows the adventures and explorations of storm chaser George Kourounis as he investigates the most extreme forces of nature in the world - hurricanes, tornadoes, volcanoes and monsoons.::Peter Rowe
